background: The contract allocation problem is the problem of determining which of the producers will take care of which contract, at minimum cost, where every contract represents an amount of commodity that has to be supplied.
constraints: The demand for contract `c` is met
Minimal number of contributors to contract `c`
Determine if producer `p` delivers to contract `c`
objective: Minimize the total cost of all deliveries
description: The contract allocation problem is the problem of determining which of the producers will take care of which contract, at minimum cost, where every contract represents an amount of commodity that has to be supplied.

parameters.definition: Unit cost for delivery by producer `p` for contract `c`
Minimal number of producers that delivery to contract `c`
